me.lihq.game.people

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion
      • com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Sprite
        • me.lihq.game.people.AbstractPerson
          • me.lihq.game.people.Player

  • public class Player
extends AbstractPerson
    This class defines the player that the person playing the game will be represented by.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class me.lihq.game.people.AbstractPerson

        public boolean isOnTriggerTile()
        This method returns whether or not the player is standing on a tile that initiates a Transition to another room
        Returns:
        (boolean) Whether the player is on a trigger tile or not

      • canAccuse

        public boolean canAccuse()
        Determines whether the player has enough information to accuse an NPC yet.
        Returns:
        True if the murder weapon has been found, at least 3 other useful (i.e. not a red herring) clues have been found, and at least 5 questions have been asked, otherwise false

      • moveRoom

        public void moveRoom(Room.Transition transition)
        This changes the room of the player based on the transition data provided to it

      • changePersonality

        public void changePersonality(AbstractPerson.Personality change)
        Changes the player's personality towards the given type, and caps the personality between 0 and 100.
        Parameters:
        change - The personality type to move in the direction of

      • addToScore

        public void addToScore(int scoreToAdd)
        Changes the player's score by the specified amount, and caps it at 0.
        Parameters:
        scoreToAdd - The number of points to add to the score. Can be negative

      • addPlayTime

        public void addPlayTime(float delta)
        Increases the gameDuration variable by the appropriate amount. Should be called from the Screen.render() method of all screens that count as playing (i.e. not the pause screen).
        Parameters:
        delta - The time difference

      • addQuestion

        public void addQuestion()
        Increments the counter for questions asked. Should be called when a question receives an actual response (i.e. not a non-response).

      • addFalseAccusation

        public void addFalseAccusation()
        Increments the counter for false accusations.

      • getSpeech

        public java.lang.String getSpeech(Clue clue,
                                  AbstractPerson.Personality style)
        Handles speech for a question about a clue.
        Parameters:
        clue - The clue to be questioned about
        style - The style of questioning
        Returns:
        The appropriate line of dialogue.

        Specified by:
        getPersonality in class AbstractPerson
        Returns:
        The current personality of the player

      • getPersonalityLevel

        public int getPersonalityLevel()
        This gets the players personality level; this similar to Personality but a integer representation
        Returns:
        Value between 0-100

      • getScore

        public int getScore()
        Returns:
        The number of points the player has earned so far this game

      • getTimeBonus

        public int getTimeBonus()
        Calculates a logarithmic time bonus. No points are awarded after approximately 45 minutes (The game shouldn't take anywhere near that long to complete).
        Returns:
        The number of bonus points the player has earned

      • getTotalScore

        public int getTotalScore()
        Returns:
        The total score the player has achieved throughout the game

      • getPlayTime

        public int getPlayTime()
        Returns:
        The duration of the game (excluding time paused) as a whole number of seconds

      • getFormattedPlayTime

        public java.lang.String getFormattedPlayTime()
        Returns:
        The duration of the game (excluding time paused) formatted as HH:MM:SS. Caps time to 99:59:59.

      • getRedHerrings

        public int getRedHerrings()
        Returns:
        The number of red herrings the player has found

      • getQuestions

        public int getQuestions()
        Returns:
        The number of questions the player has asked (excluding non-responses)

      • getFalseAccusations

        public int getFalseAccusations()
        Returns:
        The number of false accusations made by the player during this game
